result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADA Boeck makes statement.

Defendant makes statement.

Court questions defendant RE: Employment/Income. 
Court appoints Attorney Thomas Roley. Limits representation to $1,000.00.  Continue with payment plan as previously set.

Marathon County Waiver of No Contact Order- J.A.

Clerk: Nikki

INCLUDES 21CM352 AND 22CM32.
State appears by ADA Hannah Boeck; Defendant appears in person, and with Atty Kristen Lonergan.
VCRW.

Atty Lonergan is willing to serve as counsel on deft's new case.

COURT appoints Attorney Kristen Lonergan to 22CM32. Budget increased by $250 with same repayment plan as 21CM352.

Reading Waived. Reserve Jurisdiction.
Court questions defendant re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel.
PLEA: NOT GUILTY.

BOND:

-Police escort to retrieve personal property from the residence, Marathon County Sheriff's Department.
-Prints and photograph.

No contact with victim(s): J.A.A. or residence. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Police escort to retrieve personal property from the residence, Marathon County Sheriff's Department. Prints and photograph.
